website_summaries.verdict: Valvoline is a trusted brand for a reason, and it’s because of performance-enhancing products like this long-lasting, anti-varnishing, and friction-controlling transmission fluid.
pros: Formula reduces foaming, wear, and oxidation

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware !
customer_reviews.text: Used on 02 silverado, calls for dexIII, still working, will see, however I would like to add, this bs pricing going to over 30 dollars and back to 17 and change, well they are baiting you, this stuff can be had at Wall Mart for 13 dollars and change, found this out too late myself, paid nearly 18 bucks each for 2 gallons, Amazon got me for 10 bucks !
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Valvoline MaxLife Full Synthetic Multi-Vehicle Automatic Transmission
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best full synthetic transmission fluids I have ever used, and especially at this price! Other brands will cost you three times this much, and are truly no better than this Valvoline Max Life brand. It indeed will help keep your automatic transmission in tip top shape, and will also extend fluid change intervals. It will also help your transmission components to last longer than non synthetic fluids will in comparison.
customer_reviews.author: The Rifleman

customer_reviews.title: Best value synthetic transmission fluid!
customer_reviews.text: My 1997 Camry has 240,000 KMs on the original engine. Transmission fluid was never changed. It was dark brown but not black, so not burnt. There was no issues with the transmission at all, but I decided it was about time to give the car love. I changed the filter and transmission fluid to synthetic, used a WIX filter... the transmission is even slightly more smoother. I just used up my other bottles and changed out the fluid again in 3000KMs just to make sure the whole transmission got fresh fluid. No issues with the shifts. Hands down the Valvoline Synthetic Transmission fluid is the best value. Make sure you change your fluids!!
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Multi-Vehicle ATF does not meet OEM spec
customer_reviews.text: This is not a licensed product. Label says, "recommended for". Consider that before you add this to your transmission. This fluid does not meet your OEM specifications. California law specifically states that Valvoline cannot offer the item in cases where fluid does not meet OEM spec. In all other states, it's "common law", or "buyer beware". Mine was missing about 1/3 of the bottle. How can they bottle the product that way?
customer_reviews.author: Inspector Nash Bridges

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I used this in a 2003 Honda that had very dirty tranny fluid (bought it used, apparently the previous owner skimped on maintenance). In that case, the best approach is to: 1) get the car warmed up, drain and fill, 2) drive the car around then drain and fill again, 3) do another round of warming the fluid up, drain and fill then replace the tranny filter. Make sure you buy new tranny plug washers.
customer_reviews.author: Mt Spurr

customer_reviews.title: Great for Nissans matic J,K and S
customer_reviews.text: Great alternative for all of my Nissans requiring matic J, matic K and matic S. All of my Nissans are bought used with more than 80k miles of unknown service history. I did drain and fill 2x on each of my 3 Nissans. 2005 Nissan Quest 5 speed AT (USM) and my JDM 2004 Nissan X Trail and 2004 Nissan Cube 4 speed AT (I’m stationed in Okinawa, Japan). I Did not have any issues after changing them due to highmileage and unknown service history.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Espinosa

customer_reviews.title: Great oil for the Hondas!
customer_reviews.text: Strongly believe in the drain and refill of automatic transmission fluid instead of flush. And MAxLife is what I have always trusted in my Hondas. All 3 have received the drain/refill as mileage dictated and all transmissions have lived longer than expected (Honda does have it's share of auto trans failure history).
customer_reviews.author: Miataki

customer_reviews.title: 2001 WJ Grand Cherokee 242 Transfer Case
customer_reviews.text: This works as it should. After exhaustive research I found that my 2001 WJ Grand Cherokee 242 Selec Trac Transfer Case uses the ATF +4 fluid. I drained the old oil out and filled it back up with just under 2 quarts of the Valvoline Synthetic ATF +4. I drove around for about a mile and pulled off onto a dirt road. I immediately noticed that shifting from 2Hi to 4 Part Time to 4 Full Time and on into 4 Lo that it shifted much smoother. I am happy that this seems to of smoothed it up. Two thumbs up.
customer_reviews.author: John G.

customer_reviews.title: Watch the price
customer_reviews.text: I was able to snag this for cheaper than I could buy it locally. Unfortunately it is priced two to three times as much normally here on Amazon, but if you watch it sometimes the price will drop down. This works great in my fox shocks and pretty much every automatic transmission I own.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. M

customer_reviews.title: Good in TH350
customer_reviews.text: This is the blood of the TH350 transmission and it works well in our custom mud rigs. Just a tiny amount of water intrusion will ruin the paper-like seals in the transmission, requiring a rebuild, so I change fluid frequently. You can't beat Prime delivered to your door. You can save nearly half your bucks watching the two week up and down cycle here.
customer_reviews.author: J. Everett

customer_reviews.title: It's a good synthetic ATF
customer_reviews.text: This is my go-to ATF for vehicles calling for Dexron III, such as Volvo P80-chassis cars with 4-speed automatics. It's a good synthetic ATF. On my most recent Volvo ('96 850 w/ 190k miles on the original transmission), this fluid made an instant difference in the smoothness of shifts. 4000 miles later, the fluid is still bright red and the transmission is still shifting like new. I also use this fluid in the power steering box on my Volvo and '06 Ram 1500 pickup.
customer_reviews.author: Darren Asuncion

customer_reviews.title: good price
customer_reviews.text: seemed to work well in my power steering, which calls for ATF.
customer_reviews.author: rogerdpack

customer_reviews.title: Great fluid used for my 2008 Saturn Vue Greenline 4T45 transmission
customer_reviews.text: I changed the transmission fluid in my Saturn Vue Greenline and used this fluid. It was about time as I'm pushing 200,000 miles on the same transmission and had it serviced a few times by others already. I addressed GM Service Advisory 08-07-30-04-0B at the same time and put the new magnets in while replacing the old ones (something the other people that serviced my transmission should've done). My brother is also using the same stuff for his Mercedes.... I can honestly say after the transmission fluid change I could feel an increase in horse power. Messy job but someone had to do it, and might as well be me to make sure it's done properly using great fluid.
customer_reviews.author: Daveonator

customer_reviews.title: Change your BMW automatic trans. Fluid
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time, very happy with my purchase. My 2011 BMW 328I with xdrive and GM 6 speed automatic was down shifting and would not upshift normally acting strange, and jerky. Had 70,000 mi. on factory lifetime fluid. After changing to new Valvoline fluid it is shifting and acting normal again. Fairly easy DIY for someone with wrenching experience and correct tools. Takes around 7 to 8 qts. I am very happy that changing fluid myself saved me hundreds of dollers.
customer_reviews.author: doityourselfer

customer_reviews.title: Rejuvinated drive feeling
customer_reviews.text: I bought 4 6qt cases of this stuff to do a flush & filter on the transmission, and a drain and fill on the transfer case of our 2013 Tahoe 5.3L. This is one of a few full synthetic Dexron VI’s on the market. Its Valvoline too which is a name I can trust. Transmission feels new again, and even my wife remarked that the drive feel doesnt feel or sound like its got 92K on it anymore... happy wife happy life
customer_reviews.author: Trigger8318

customer_reviews.title: Great ATF! Wide variety of vehicles it can be used in too!
customer_reviews.text: Had transmission codes P0713 and P0711 which are transmission temperature sensor codes in my 2011 Kia Sorento. I replaced the sensor with a new OEM one and used Valvoline full synthetic transmission fluid. I thought about using the Max-Life fluid but you get what you pay for and I think the regular fluid lasts longer. My Kia shifts great after replacing the sensor and refilling it with Valvoline Full Synthetic ATF.
customer_reviews.author: Shelltracks

customer_reviews.title: Sent WRONG item
customer_reviews.text: first time but it sucks...I needed this and its a real Bi___ to return. They sent Valvoline CVT Full Synthetic Continuously Variable Transmission Fluid
customer_reviews.author: ED

customer_reviews.title: high quality
customer_reviews.text: just used this on my 2013 Ford Escape S 2.5L with 50,000 miles. i did 3 drain and fills. my car runs smoother and quieter. gas mileage went up just a bit. i mainly wanted to replace the mineral oil ford uses and upgrade it with full synthetic trans oil.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Valvoline DEXRON/MERCON Automatic Transmission Fluid
customer_reviews.text: Valvoline products are very well known and respected in the automotive industry, and for good reason... they can be trusted to do the job perfectly that they are intended for. The price for this particular product works out to be around $3.50 per quart at Amazon, which is really hard to beat, especially considering it's a very well know and trusted brand.
customer_reviews.author: The Rifleman

customer_reviews.title: Causes slipping
customer_reviews.text: Used for my Dexron III specced transmission and caused slipping shifts. Correct level verified on dipstick in "hot" range with engine running after a 45 minute drive. Immediately flushed out using 4x drain and fill of genuine OEM ATF fluid, and shifting is now back to normal. Waste of $80, hopefully this garbage didn't cause permanent damage to my $$$$ transmission.
customer_reviews.author: John Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great experience I recommend
customer_reviews.text: This product was used in my 2002 trans am transmission change was performed 25,000 miles early When dumping the fluid and pan it was in excellent condition no residue in bottom of pan and or metal on magnet it was like I just replaced I could have went another 50 thousand more miles very Happy with product I recommend
customer_reviews.author: MANNIX 33

customer_reviews.title: Always works great! Excellent value!
customer_reviews.text: One of the best fluids for the money! Fits tons of vehicles and has a lot of additives for higher mileage transmissions. All of my vehicles have this fluid and I’ve used it on a lot of friends and families vehicles with no issues. Don’t use it in a CVT or German vehicle like Audi or bmw etc. most Japanese and American vehicles love it though! Amazon was the cheapest at $4.44 a quart on sale.
customer_reviews.author: Reach for the SCCY

customer_reviews.title: Transmission fluid change 2004 Chevrolet Silverado 1500 4l60E
customer_reviews.text: 2004 Chevrolet Silverado 1500 4l60E with 130000 miles. Runs with no problems to begin with. Used this for a transmission fluid change of about 5Qts. Previously using Dexron 3. This did not change anything. Shifts feel as smooth and like before. The price is good for the improvements described in the new specs. Will update if anything changes
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: EXACTLY WHAT THE TRANS REPAIR SHOP SAID TO USE
customer_reviews.text: 1982 GM 6.2 liter diesel. Lots of confusion on the web/searching. "GM says that DEX 6 full synthetic trans fluid supercedes all previous required fluid type." i read, over and over again. Trans shop that has been here forever, a great shop, says Dex 6 is too thin for that old trans. A tranny and labor can cost 7,500 bucks now, so I change this fluid often. A stack of cases of this tranny fluid, would be cheaper than the tow truck, to drag your broken down vehicle to the shop!
customer_reviews.author: spanky

customer_reviews.title: Awesome stuff. Toyota atf compatible
customer_reviews.text: It may not be oem Toyota fluid but it sure performs like it. Used in my ls430 (Toyota type 4 atf spec) and gx470 (WS atf spec) also used in my power steering (dexron 3 spec) I noticed smoother almost impercivable shifting after 140k miles on the original black so called life time fluid. Ps system runs quieter and is much lighter in steering effort after complete drain and fill.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: been using this for many years 100%
customer_reviews.text: I love this type of transmission.Valvoline Dexron Mercon automatic.I use it in my 94 s10 that has the 4 speed automatic 4l60e Transmission.I have used it for years.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'm not sure how, but Valvoline has made a fluid that is nearly universal and actually works.
customer_reviews.text: I've used this fluid both professionally and in my personal vehicles for various applications including GM Dexron VI, Hyundai SP-IV, Mercon LV, and Toyota WS fluid. So far neither my customers or myself have ANY complaints. Combined with the low price and Valvoline's long-standing reputation for quality, this is a no-brainer for me to use on it's listed applications.
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: Valvoline is great
customer_reviews.text: I liked this transmission fluid for my Toyotas Camry and Avalon it's always good to change the fluid every 2 years. It calls for this fluid and it's more at Auto parts stores.. The condition of the old was brown so changing it was a good thing..
customer_reviews.author: carl

customer_reviews.title: Exactly What I Needed
customer_reviews.text: I went hunting for some Type F fluid at the local auto parts stores since I needed to change out the fluid in my 1965 mustang. Out of 3 of my local stores, I only found 3 quarts at one of the stores. Most people looked puzzled when I asked for Type F when I didn't see it on the self. I looked on here and found 6 quarts for about the same price as the parts store. I've never had trouble with Valvoline so I assume this product will give me years of service. Can't beat having it delivered in a day either.
customer_reviews.author: HackMATTr

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, quality product and unbeatable price
customer_reviews.text: Great basic fluid for a trans and power steering flush. I can buy this by the gallon on Amazon for what my local auto parts store charges me for a quart. Fantastic deal! I'll leave it in the truck for a couple months and then change it for something synthetic for a bit better temp stability.
customer_reviews.author: Strange_1

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous fluid ... use where Dexron products are specified
customer_reviews.text: I use this in my automatic transmission and for power steering fluid and it is a superb product. Instantly improves the steering feel (when used as power steering fluid), and is superb in the tranny. Don't even think about trying to save a couple of bucks on lubricants for the most demanding systems on your car.
customer_reviews.author: Graham Hager Motors

customer_reviews.title: Used this Valvoline product for 2008 Ford Edge transmission service
customer_reviews.text: Ford auto transmissions need the MERCON products, however I put some trust in this VALVOLINE PRODUCT due to previous good results, and it did not fail again. May add that the previous transmission transaxle fluid DID NOT PROVIDE the best protection to many of the transaxle bearings, THEY ARE NOISY, SOME LOOSE! Ford recommends the MERCON IV OR V PRODUCT LINES to this vehicle, this is the second Ford Edge with heavily worn auto transmission-transaxle!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Feldman

customer_reviews.title: Good brand, no idea how good is the product in real life.
customer_reviews.text: At first I thought this oil fixed my noisy transmission but it didn’t. I know it shouldn’t fix anything but I was hoping ;) Anyway, my first gear is now much easier to handle and the noise of the reverse gear got better. There is not way to accurately review it, we are all just trust the manufacturer I guess. There is one guy on YT that compares oils and it looks like Amazon makes the same quality if not better oils for lower prices.
customer_reviews.author: LoLa

customer_reviews.title: Needed to replace what was lost when changing tranny oil pan
customer_reviews.text: I needed to swap out a tranny pan before it failed on me. this is what I replaced what I had removed for the swap. even though this was only about 1/3rd of the ATF in my truck, I can say it does feel smoother.
customer_reviews.author: Double A-Rod

customer_reviews.title: Great Replacement for Honda OE and LOTS less money
customer_reviews.text: If you do trans fluid drain and fills, this is the stuff to get! Right away you get better shifts, smoother operation and it will NOT harm the Honda trans which is extremely picky about the fluids used. Highly recommended on many Honda sites for that reason. Great price here on Amazon too!
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn M

customer_reviews.title: VERY versatile tranny fluid - VV324
customer_reviews.text: This stuff worked great on 2011 Sonata, 1999 Sonata and 2004 Suburban. I noticed improved shifting in all 3 vehicles.
customer_reviews.author: Master Blaster

customer_reviews.title: Works great for Chrysler transmissions
customer_reviews.text: Needed this special Chrysler only transmission fluid to do a drain and refill on my Dodge's manual tranny. This fluid was reasonably priced and worked just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Weekend Woodbutcher

customer_reviews.title: Why buy  3 in one box when you can save buying them individually
customer_reviews.text: Don’t let yourself get taken for a ride. By 3 individual gallons and save $26 over the three pack
customer_reviews.author: W. Daws

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: Had a very slight leak; not enough to pay for a mechanic to fix on such an old car. Figured the poor man's fix of just adding a little every few months will work. This was a quality product for a good price that I can add a little at a time and save the rest for later.
customer_reviews.author: John R.

customer_reviews.title: Found my Valveline oil on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: I was changing tranny fluid and the tranny filter, so I needed several quarts of oil. Went to the local store and bought 4 qts. and that was all they had left. I was getting a transmission cooler pan, so I needed extra quarts of oil, so when I saw the Valvaline that I wanted, I was happy to buy it by the case. I was very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Holly G Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Dex/merc
customer_reviews.text: Was not mercon v. Got dex/merc had to send back
customer_reviews.author: Naudia J.

customer_reviews.title: Used on 2003 ram 1500 4.7 P.S
customer_reviews.text: Topped off my power steering system in truck with this
customer_reviews.author: Co

customer_reviews.title: Great Oil/Transmission and Power Steering
customer_reviews.text: Great product and I used to his for my Lexus GX and IS power steering. Highly recommend this for anyone needing a dexron II or III fluid.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Transmission shifting better.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Pricey but worth it. I have a Hyundai with over 100k.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: I use this ATF exclusively on any high mileage transmission I work on. It's not the Top product out there (Pentosin, AMS, just to name a couple), but it's reliable and fairly priced. I've never had an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Pixel_Dust

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great, really can tell the difference when changing the fluid, the shifting is so firm and tighter. It can be messy even with the right tools but it is easy to clean up with a degreaser.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Mullins

customer_reviews.title: TOP QUALITY OIL
customer_reviews.text: This ATF+4 i used in my chrysler product. Valvoline makes alot of great products. It is always a good idea to check and use the correct fluid. there have been alot of people who put in a universal fluid and then have transmission slips and then Some had to flush the whole system out.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph  Wentworth

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my 1998 Jeep Cherokee XJ
customer_reviews.text: Works great for my 1998 Jeep Cherokee XJ. Overall great price for the size. Much better price than I can find in the stores. I have purchased again.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Great lubricant for engine protection
customer_reviews.text: This well known and effective lubricant is just perfect for my WWII Sherman tank. Keeps it running all month creating havoc throughout the neighborhood!
customer_reviews.author: TKB

customer_reviews.title: Has worked well
customer_reviews.text: This ATF can be used for PSF for our Chrysler minivan. Replaced the old fluid with this and everything has been working well with no issues. Much cheaper than Mopar and this was recommended in manual as a substitute so happy with the cheaper price.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S

customer_reviews.title: When Valvoline quality is needed
customer_reviews.text: I'm having a 5.0 stroker motor built/installed for my Mustang that will deliver over 500 RWHP. A new power steering pump was installed and I needed some quality ATF fluid. I went to four different branded stores and only found 'their store brand ATF fluid." Would their products have worked - probably so, but I've got over $15K in this build so I turned to AMAZON for some, in my opinion, quality fluid. I used Valvoline in my old pump, so this was a no-brainer. When quality matters, go with quality -- and, then go to AMAZON to buy the quality product.
customer_reviews.author: 2016LBRZ06

customer_reviews.title: I used the Valvoline and I have been very happy (partially complete flush)(2 x 3 quarts)
customer_reviews.text: I used this in my 2005 Honda Accord. I had been very nervous about performing any kind of transmission service, as this had in past created more problems in my 1999 Honda. I used the Valvoline and I have been very happy (partially complete flush)(2 x 3 quarts). I have noted firmer upshifts and downshifts, but I prefer this over the slushy horrible shifts that accompanied the stock tranny fluid. I cant say enough good things. I would recommend this product highly over the stock or replacement OEM fluids.
customer_reviews.author: john  learned

customer_reviews.title: Great full synthetic fluid
customer_reviews.text: At 4.44/qt, this was actually less expensive than the $17.97 gallon @wm
customer_reviews.author: J Miller

customer_reviews.title: great if price under like $ 6
customer_reviews.text: works in almost EVERY Car brand which is good. tranny shifts smooth no issues. its all i use in my mitsubishi and confident it will keep my tranny in great shape,my lancer has 180000 and runs great still.
customer_reviews.author: fitzy

customer_reviews.title: Easier to pour than a 5 qt jug
customer_reviews.text: Good price and found it easier to have measured 1 qt amounts for an even exchange out of my 2001 ram 1500. Transmission is smooth shifting. Did the change out at 39800.
customer_reviews.author: Linus van Pelt

customer_reviews.title: A little surprised when a "walmart.com" box arrived.
customer_reviews.text: Good ATF, works well. Honda Element needs three ATF changes for a "complete" fluid change, so the 3-pack was great. I was a little surprised when a "walmart.com" box arrived, but product was as-represented and worked as expected.
customer_reviews.author: oldbaritone

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this automatic transmission fluid for my 98 Toyota Corolla Le & it's as advertised and since it's Dexron 3 I can use it in my power steering. What a great value for the price. A must buy.
customer_reviews.author: Reginald Law

customer_reviews.title: false description
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this +4 synthetic ATF for a transmission that is having shifting issues. I specifically wanted this ATF to help narrow down the problem. Instead I received the universal max life ATF with a barcode sticker stuck to it saying it was the product I ordered. Not impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great company and great product
customer_reviews.text: changed tranny oil in my class C RV...taveled 7,300 miles in 95 to over 100 degree heat...NO problems, did well
customer_reviews.author: Janis Dyment

customer_reviews.title: Very happy, it arrived on time
customer_reviews.text: Very happy, it arrived on time, it's exactly what I was looking for. The price could have been a little bit lower considering one of these gallons at Walmart is less than $20. But overall I'm still happy.
customer_reviews.author: DZ1

customer_reviews.title: It's ATF+4
customer_reviews.text: I'm partial to Valvoline, and I needed ATF+4. Not much else to say. I'd run any ATF+4 if I run out of stock.
customer_reviews.author: SA

customer_reviews.title: Best price I could find for a complete transmission fliud change.
customer_reviews.text: I had to do a full transmission fluid change on my Saturn Aura and this deal on the Valvoline DEXRON-VI Full-Synthetic Automatic Transmission Fluid was the best price I could find in the quantity I needed. I can't use anything but DEXRON VI in my car, so it is more expensive than the other fluids. Plan to buy it again for my next service.
customer_reviews.author: NJ Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Power steering refresh!
customer_reviews.text: Flushed my power steering fluid on my 2001 4Runner and must I say I have felt the difference. Power steering pump is noticeably quieter and for the price can regular service without breaking the bank. Would recommend to anyone that’s vehicle calls for this fluid.
customer_reviews.author: Marcos Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Good oil
customer_reviews.text: Worked on my Toyota Tacoma power steering system where dexron was needed Update : recently repurchased and used in my transmission , shifting has improved great overall
customer_reviews.author: forts619

customer_reviews.title: trans flush
customer_reviews.text: used all 3 gallons on a trans flush and this stuff is awesome to use. Save your money and do it yourself, it's easy and will save you $150.00 at minimum. my 2005 yukon shifts much better now, and I don't have to worry about burnt trans fluid in the summer months.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Much cheaper per gallon than local auto parts store. ...
customer_reviews.text: Much cheaper per gallon than local auto parts store. Did a drain and fill on 2007 4Runner. Some people reported issues w/ slipping after not using Toyota WS, however, I've been running it for 6 weeks and have had no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Colin

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: This is the only product I use in my 28-year-old Toyota Celica. Automatic transmission. Much better value to buy by the gallon, rather than by the quart.
customer_reviews.author: Patty  B.  Miami

customer_reviews.title: Very good synthetic
customer_reviews.text: Did the ATF cycle in my jeep liberty sport 2007 and niw transmission is working so smloth like brand new without doing an expensive flush i do flush every 40k
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Quality fluid at an great price.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this on a 2001 Malibu and a 2005 Buick Terraza to replace the older Dex III. Both seem to shift smoother and I gain the added protection of a full synthetic. Can't beat the price either. When buying the case of 6, it is cheaper than the "synthetic blend Castroil" sold at the local auto parts stores.
customer_reviews.author: Michael I.

customer_reviews.title: Good product and meets my Jeep Specs
customer_reviews.text: I trust this tranny fluid as it meets all my needs for a 42RE in my Jeep WJ. It's full synthetic and will last a good while before next change.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Price for volume
customer_reviews.text: I needed to flush my Power Steering system on a 2002 Toyota. This fit the bill at a cost comparable to 10oz from the local auto parts store.
customer_reviews.author: Test Pilot

customer_reviews.title: Synthetic +4 fluid.
customer_reviews.text: I needed to replace my transfer case fluid in my Ram 3500 5 speed auto transmission. Manual says 2 quarts but it took 3. This +4 fluid is full synthetic. Easy to do and works well.
customer_reviews.author: Paul R. Haller

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: came shipped in one convenient box, the back of the bottle explains all cars it can be used for.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Split container when delivered.
customer_reviews.text: Product is great. When delivered the packing in the box was not soft enough or someone put something heavy on top of box. One container split and leaked a majority of the fluid out. Split was at seam of container.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh Webb

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Transmission Oil
customer_reviews.text: Don't ever go cheap when it comes to your transmission. I purchased this synthetic Dexron 6 oil for my scheduled maintenance transmission oil change and after a month of use my GM vehicle runs and shifts a lot better than before, you will notice the difference right away and your car will love you for it, just remember: "if you take care of your car, your car will take care of you". I will definitely purchase this oil again.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A

customer_reviews.title: Many users claim this fluid is better than Honda OEM for smoother shifts and life of transmission.
customer_reviews.text: Many users claim this fluid is better than Honda OEM for smoother shifts and life of transmission.
customer_reviews.author: JSMCO

customer_reviews.title: Good fluid for the price.
customer_reviews.text: used this in my 2011 mazda 2 automatic transmission. Much better value than the factory stuff per quart.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Harter

customer_reviews.title: Great oil
customer_reviews.text: Very good transmission oil. And the price it's even better. I put it on my sonata 2012 and runs great.
customer_reviews.author: isaac.....G

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for 2nd Gen Tacoma Power Steeering and Auto Transmissions
customer_reviews.text: This is all I use when I do a drain and refill of my Tacoma's transmission and/or do a flush of my power steering. Great synthetic fluid with multiple uses for Tacomas.
customer_reviews.author: FDC

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I don’t work great. I’m not having any transmission issues that weren’t there before. The transmission does seem to run a little bit smoother.
customer_reviews.author: margaret

customer_reviews.title: excellent product for my GM tranny'd BMW
customer_reviews.text: So far so good in our 2011 E90 BMW. I did a drain and refill, drove for a week and drained and replaced the filter. Noticeable improvement in the shifting-firmer, faster. Glad its 100% synthetic. Will use when it's time to replace the fluid in our GMC.
customer_reviews.author: amazonRocker

customer_reviews.title: Best of the best
customer_reviews.text: Only oil I will spend my money on. Valvoline has kept all 3 of my trucks goin past 250,000 with absolutely no motor or transmission issues.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 2008 BMW 535i
customer_reviews.text: This product works just fine in my transmission. At 1/3 the cost of pentosin.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Essential for pre-1980 Fords
customer_reviews.text: I went back to the factory recommended Type F for my C6 transmission (which is also the spec for steering fluid). My transmission got a nice flush and refill of this stuff and I'm good for another decade.
customer_reviews.author: Victor

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine. I used it in a 2002 Corolla that ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine. I used it in a 2002 Corolla that calls for Dexron because I think it is reverse compatible. So far no problems. I don't know if you can still get real Dexron. You have to decide for yourself. I used it in both the transmission and power steering.
customer_reviews.author: gregory

customer_reviews.title: works great in my 2007 chrysler town and country
customer_reviews.text: atf 4 works fine, no issue in the chryler town and country. price was good
customer_reviews.author: theSuperHubby

customer_reviews.title: My grandson's VW jetta transmission is operating quiet and smooth.
customer_reviews.text: My grandson's VW jetta transmission is operating quiet and smooth. Based on smell (burnt ) and color (very black), of the trans. fluid, this car was driven very hard by the previous owner.
customer_reviews.author: Old Grumps

customer_reviews.title: so far it seems to work fine no issues tranny is shifting fine
customer_reviews.text: Used this transmission fluid on my 2011 Durango R/T ~ 545RFE tranny two weeks ago, so far it seems to work fine no issues tranny is shifting fine. My transmission took 8 qts. will buy again on future fluid changes. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Here we go
customer_reviews.text: Used it for my vibes power steering fluid change out. Works well.
customer_reviews.author: Linus van Pelt

customer_reviews.title: Used it for transmission service of 2008 PT Cruiser
customer_reviews.text: This Valvoline Multi-Vehicle 100% Synthetic is working well with the 2008 PT Cruiser!!
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Feldman

customer_reviews.title: As described
customer_reviews.text: As described and it is better than most budget atf
customer_reviews.author: HMMMM

customer_reviews.title: Great price and fast shipping
customer_reviews.text: Was a great price . What can I say it’s transmission oil and it’s what I was told to use
customer_reviews.author: Tom Perkins

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great product for a great price. You want be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: julie waldroup

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff as always
customer_reviews.text: Great price, I wish i had bought more while it was cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for OEM fluid
customer_reviews.text: This product replaced my OEM Honda fluid. It is less expensive, lasts longer and has better protection for the transmission. Nuff said.
customer_reviews.author: reddawn

customer_reviews.title: 2003 2.4 altima
customer_reviews.text: Did 3 drain and fills on a 03 altima AND also did the powersteering! Cars running great!!
customer_reviews.author: Alfredo Rojas

customer_reviews.title: Works in my Sonata
customer_reviews.text: I flushed the AT in my 2009 Sonata at 60k and it made a huge difference in the 2-1 downshift. Before it was more of a jerk than a shift but that has almost been eliminated. Update at 61k: the 2-1 downshift jerk is no more! This stuff is the real thing.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Blaine

customer_reviews.title: Great price and quality product
customer_reviews.text: Great price and quality product from a brand I trust. If I can't find a fluid or oil in AC Delco, my next go-to is Valvoline. Works great in my 08 TBSS 4L70E trans.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great power steering fluid
customer_reviews.text: Works great as cheap, convienent power steering fluid. Never used this in a transmission.
customer_reviews.author: Tobi

customer_reviews.title: i highly recommend simply doing a double fluid change
customer_reviews.text: did a double fluid change on a 2009 Ford Edge with 125k miles on it 3k miles apart and it works as new. screw the flush. ive had to replace more transmissions after a flush than if id never done anything to them. i highly recommend simply doing a double fluid change. even a single but never the flush
customer_reviews.author: Gene A.

product_meta.title: Valvoline DEXRON VI/MERCON LV (ATF) Full Synthetic Automatic Transmission Fluid 1 QT
product_meta.description: Style:DEXRON VI| Size:1 Quart| Configuration:DEXRON VIValvoline DEXRON -VI ATF (automatic transmission fluid) is formulated with premium synthetic base stocks and advanced additive technology, and meets all the stringent requirements of General Motors' DEXRON -VI specification*, which is designed for the modern automatic transmissions in GM vehicles. Valvoline DEXRON -VI ATF is officially licensed with GM and can be used in new and old GM automatic transmissions. It is fully backserviceable and can be used wherever DEXRON -II and/or DEXRON -III are recommended.
feature_bullets: Formulated with full-synthetic base stocks and advanced additive technology to meet the challenging demands of automatic transmissions
Enhanced anti-shudder protection for smooth shifting and maximum power transfer
Developed with anti-wear technology to help improve transmission durability
Engineered with a proprietary blend of base oils and advanced additives to provide better oil flow at low temperatures and greater film protection at higher temperatures

specifications.Cover Included: Auto part, Automotive Accessories, Replacement and Performance parts
